channel.title: How to put ip in client
channel.description: How to put my ip on client what i need to search for file and where i need to put the ip

item.title: How to put ip in client
item.dc:creator: @cloudscape cloudscape
item.description:
@cloudscape wrote:

[quote=“ArnuxaS, post:5, topic:244837”]if i turn on client and automaticly join in the client but i think its localhost ip so how do i find that
where i need to put my ip in egui
This is EGUI.JAVA

public class EGUI { public static void main(String args[]) { client.main(new String[] { "", "", "" }); } }
and where i need to put in client.java[/quote]

Ok i will use egscape to help you.

client.main(new String[] { "", "", ""

inbetween the >""< you add your server ip or leave it blank for your use, eg

client.main(new String[] { "egscape.no-ip.org", "egscape.no-ip.org", "egscape.no-ip.org"

or leave it how it is for your use,

as for the client.java search

signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());

and the next line reads signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); setserver("unwantedscape.no-ip.org", "43594");

i used unwantedscape.no-ip.org to show this is the part you don’t want, you simply change that to signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); setserver("egscape.no-ip.org", "43594");

or again leave it blank for your personal use.

Change all “egscape.no-ip.org” to your server ip.

Hope this helped.

Read full topic
item.source: How to put ip in client

This is EGUI.JAVA

public class EGUI { public static void main(String args[]) { client.main(new String[] { "", "", "" }); } }
and where i need to put in client.java

item.title: How to put ip in client
item.dc:creator: @cloudscape cloudscape
item.description:
@cloudscape wrote:

localhost is from your pc, meaning only you can log into this, that is why you make a client with a blank ip slot.

Hope this helped.

item.title: How to put ip in client
item.dc:creator: @cloudscape cloudscape
item.description:
@cloudscape wrote:

O.K you have to look what the existing server ip is in the client then open up client.java and EGUI.java and search for the ip already in there and change it to yours, Then just compile and run, also, if you are making one for yourself to log into, you have to leave the ip blank which results in you having 2 clients one with your ip and one with no ip.

Read full topic
